intro: Pleurophora pusilla var. minima, commonly known as the dwarf pleurophora, is a small, herbaceous plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is often considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
